content.body: bakkot: , Grammar/engine question on an idea I've had in my issues for ages. Related to this issue: https://github.com/sirisian/ecmascript-types/issues/79 Basically say an engine is aware of types, could it handle transferring the type to argument expressions. f(a:uint64){} and you called f(2\*\*63); The engine when parsing would choose the overload (in this case there's only one function) and propagate the type, so it's like f(uint64(2)\*\*uint64(63)).

content.body: @tolmasky: I don't think the spec really says whether or not your `global.Francisco = { }` qualifies as an intrinsic. Personally, I'd call it one, I think.
